intro: Blakea podagrica subsp. ciliata, commonly known as the ciliated blakea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves with ciliate margins. It produces clusters of small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. This subspecies is often found growing in shaded, humid environments such as forests and undergrowth.
